intro: Stachys argillicola subsp. barbisina, commonly known as the hairy stachys, is a perennial herb native to specific regions of Europe. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, clay-rich soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
